message.content:
cs.GT, cs.AI, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with computational aspects of persuasion, which is a topic that falls under game theory (cs.GT). The use of Bayesian models and optimization algorithms suggests that the paper could also be classified under artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Information theory (cs.IT) is also relevant, as the paper deals with the transmission of information from the sender to the receiver. The use of polynomial-time algorithms and complexity analysis suggests that the paper could also be classified under data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). Finally, the paper deals with approximation algorithms and computational guarantees, which suggests that it could also be classified under machine learning (cs.LG).
